review: Did not care for it. At first, I loved the sleek design but when it comes down to use I had several problems with it performing. Plug wasnt sturdy enough and kept coming out of my power strip, the remote stopped working once I installed the remote app on my iphone, and the actual Fire Stick was flimsy and wobbled in the HDMI port on my TV and would keep turning off until I got up and fiddled around with it. I wanted to love it but it was too tempermental in design, it didnt work half the time. Returning after trying to use it for two days unsuccessfully. Roku time I suppose.
author: C. Favilla

review: I purchased this device almost exclusively to watch MLB.TV, and it hasn't worked properly in a month. Buffers every 5 seconds, rendering games completely unwatchable. Support from MLB.TV has been a bunch of excuses.  Skip this and purchase a Roku3. We have it on another TV and it works flawlessly. On a positive note, Amazon supported apps, like Prime, work with no hiccups whatsoever. Shocking.
